listitem.para: Comma separated list of address pools from where the IKEv1 (IPv4 Mode Config server) and IKEv2 (IPv4 and IPv6 configuration payload server) can assign IP addresses to clients. At most one one IPv4 and one IPv6 pool may be specified. The leftaddresspool= option can not be combined with with either the leftsubnet= or leftsubnets= options.

A pool is specified using either an address range (for instance, leftaddresspool=192.168.1.100-192.168.1.200 or CIDR (for instance, leftaddresspool=2001:db8:0:3:1::/97) syntax. For IPv6, the CIDR syntax has been extended to also allow the specification of a subnet, for instance leftaddresspool=2001:db8:0:3:1::/60/64 will allocate /64 leases. While address pools are grown as required and leases are reclaimed, the size of an address pool should be reasonable. For instance, the pool leftaddresspool=10.0.0.0-11.0.0.0 will eventually result in an in-memory structure containing 16 million leases.
Address pools specifying the exact same range are shared between connections. Different addresspools cannot partially overlap.

For IKEv1, when right is configured as a server using rightxauthserver=&yes;, this option specifies the address pool from which IP addresses are taken to assign the left clients during the Mode Config exchange. Generally, the leftaddresspool= option will be accompanied by leftxauthclient=&yes;, rightxauthserver=&yes; and rightsubnet=0.0.0.0/0 option.

History: &Libreswan; version 3.30 added support for IPv6 addresses, and replaced a static table with dynamic O(1) structures; &Libreswan; 5.0 added support for combined IPv4 and IPv6 address pools; &Libreswan; 5.4 added support for IPv6 subnets. &Libreswan; should allow the combination of addresspool and subnet, patches would be welcome.
